articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Soccer-Pogba facing "few weeks" out with latest ankle problems - Solskjaer
articles.description: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba will be out of action "for a few weeks" after missing Wednesday's match at Arsenal due to further problems with his ankle, manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba will be out of action “for a few weeks” after missing Wednesday’s match at Arsenal due to further problems with his ankle, manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Austrian conservatives and Greens reach coalition deal, Greens say
articles.description: Austrian conservative leader Sebastian Kurz on Wednesday reached a coalition deal with the Greens to ensure his return to power and bring the left-wing party into government for the first time, a Greens spokeswoman and a source close to the talks said.
articles.content: VIENNA (Reuters) - Austrian conservative leader Sebastian Kurz on Wednesday reached a coalition deal with the Greens to ensure his return to power and bring the left-wing party into government for the first time, a Greens spokeswoman and a source close to the… [+378 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Poland hit by bird flu outbreak on turkey farms
articles.description: Bird flu has been detected in turkeys in eastern Poland, authorities said on Wednesday, and local media reported that the outbreak could require up to 40,000 birds to be slaughtered.
articles.content:
WARSAW (Reuters) - Bird flu has been detected in turkeys in eastern Poland, authorities said on Wednesday, and local media reported that the outbreak could require up to 40,000 birds to be slaughtered. 
Poland, Europe’s largest poultry producer according to … [+749 chars]

articles.title: Czech PM would allow higher 2020 budget deficit if slowdown worsens
articles.description: The Czech government could allow the 2020 central state budget deficit to grow beyond a planned 40 billion crown (1.34 billion pounds) gap to boost investments if a slowdown worsens, Prime Minister Andrej Babis told Czech Television on Wednesday.

articles.title: Jesus double helps Man City inflict first defeat on Ancelotti
articles.description: Two goals from Gabriel Jesus helped a nervy Manchester City earn a 2-1 victory over Everton at the Etihad Stadium on Wednesday, as new Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti suffered his first Premier League defeat.
articles.content:
MANCHESTER (Reuters) - Two goals from Gabriel Jesus helped a nervy Manchester City earn a 2-1 victory over Everton at the Etihad Stadium on Wednesday, as new Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti suffered his first Premier League defeat.

articles.title: Moyes makes flying start as West Ham crush Bournemouth
articles.description: David Moyes made a perfect start to his second spell in charge of West Ham after two goals from Mark Noble and one each by Felipe Anderson and Sebastien Haller gave the Hammers a 4-0 home win over Bournemouth on Wednesday.

LONDON (Reuters) - David Moyes made a perfect start to his second spell in charge of West Ham after two goals from Mark Noble and one each by Felipe Anderson and Sebastien Haller gave the Hammers a 4-0 home win over Bournemouth on Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Late Wickham striker for Palace frustrates Norwich
articles.description: An 87th minute goal from Connor Wickham, allowed by a VAR review, earned Crystal Palace a 1-1 draw at bottom club Norwich City, a bitter blow for the struggling Canaries.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - An 87th minute goal from Connor Wickham, allowed by a VAR review, earned Crystal Palace a 1-1 draw at bottom club Norwich City, a bitter blow for the struggling Canaries.
